column1: Control medicines for asthma are drugs you take to control your asthma symptoms.
If your child cannot use an inhaler, your doctor will give you a drug to use with a nebulizer.
Your doctor may ask you to take both a steroid drug and a long-acting beta-agonist drug.
These medicines are used to prevent asthma symptoms.
Cromolyn is a medicine that may prevent asthma symptoms.
